DataElement.preferredName: Pathology Report Mitotic Count Rate Malignant Neoplasm Diagnosis Ind-4
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable related to the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of malignant disease by a report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment by determining the number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pathology Report Mitotic Count Rate Malignant Neoplasm Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of malignant disease by a report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment by determining the number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pathology report provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. Report defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread. Essential information to be included in a pathology report: the date and name of the report, slide number, the source of the specimen, the primary tumor size, he histologic diagnosis including the grade or degree of differentiation, the extent of disease within and beyond the primary site.

Concepts.definition: A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread.

Property.preferredName: Mitotic Count Rate Malignant Neoplasm Diagnosis
Property.preferredDefinition: The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors. It is one of the parameters that determine the grade of malignant tumors. The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined. Usually the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.:A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time. (NCI):A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors.  It is one of the parameters that determine the grade of malignant tumors.  The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined.  Usually the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.
A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
